dashboard.welcome: Welcome back! Here's what's happening with your business today.

grossProfit.title: Gross Profit
grossProfit.description: Gross profit is calculated by subtracting the purchase price from the selling price for each product sold, then multiplying by the quantity sold.
grossProfit.formula: Formula: Œ£((Selling Price - Purchase Price) √ó Quantity Sold) for each product in each sale
grossProfit.example: Example: If you sell 5 units of a product that costs 1000 XAF and sells for 1500 XAF: Gross Profit = (1500 - 1000) √ó 5 = 2500 XAF

netProfit.title: Net Profit
netProfit.description: Net profit is the gross profit minus all business expenses.
netProfit.example: Example: If your gross profit is 100,000 XAF and total expenses are 30,000 XAF: Net Profit = 100,000 - 30,000 = 70,000 XAF

totalExpenses.title: Total Expenses
totalExpenses.description: The sum of all business expenses across all categories.
totalExpenses.formula: Formula: Œ£(Expense Amount) for all expenses
totalExpenses.includes: This includes all types of expenses such as: Delivery expenses, Utility bills, Rent, Other operational costs

totalSalesAmount.title: Total Sales Amount
totalSalesAmount.description: The total revenue from all sales, including any negotiated prices.
totalSalesAmount.formula: Formula: Œ£(Sale Amount) for each sale
totalSalesAmount.note: Note: If a product was sold at a negotiated price, that price is used instead of the standard selling price.

deliveryExpenses.title: Delivery Expenses
deliveryExpenses.description: The sum of all expenses categorized as 'delivery'.
deliveryExpenses.formula: Formula: Œ£(Expense Amount) for all expenses with category = 'delivery'

bestSellingProducts.title: Best Selling Products
bestSellingProducts.description: Products are ranked by the total quantity sold.
bestSellingProducts.formula: For each product: Total Quantity = Œ£(Quantity Sold) across all sales, Total Sales = Œ£(Selling Price √ó Quantity Sold) across all sales
bestSellingProducts.note: Products are then sorted by total quantity in descending order.

totalPurchasePrice.title: Total Purchase Price
totalPurchasePrice.description: The total purchase price is the sum of the purchase prices of all products currently in stock. For each product, multiply the purchase price by the quantity in stock, then sum everything.
totalPurchasePrice.formula: Formula: Œ£(Purchase Price √ó Stock Quantity) for each product
totalPurchasePrice.example: Example: If you have 10 units of a product with a purchase price of 1000 XAF, and 5 units of another at 2000 XAF: Total Purchase Price = (10 √ó 1000) + (5 √ó 2000) = 10,000 + 10,000 = 20,000 XAF.
